Expectation1: Ensure client satisfaction and address any concerns or complaints professionally
Situation1: A first-time visitor looks disappointed with the colour tone in the mirror.
Expectation2: Contribute to community well-being through paying taxes, following public health and safety guidance, and helping in emergencies
Situation2: A flash-flood warning triggers building alarms as water rises along the block.
Story: I was just finishing up the colour on a first-time client when I noticed her frown in the mirror. She hesitated, then quietly said the tone wasn’t what she’d hoped for. My heart sank—I knew how important it was to make her feel heard and happy, especially on her first visit. I started to reassure her, ready to discuss options and fix it right away. Suddenly, the building alarms blared, and my phone buzzed with a flash-flood warning. I glanced outside and saw water creeping up the street, people shouting and running. As a citizen, I knew I should help evacuate, check on neighbors, and follow safety protocols. But as a hairdresser, I had a disappointed client in my chair, expecting my full attention and a solution. My mind raced, torn between my duty to her and my responsibility to the community. I could feel the pressure mounting, my hands trembling as I tried to decide what to do next.
